results.title: Bike people
results.creator_credit: Phil Kassel and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: More and more people are riding bikes today, and here the basic safety precautions, optional equipment and protection against theft are discussed. The film explains bike vehicle code rules which are designed to make riding safe and fun, and points out that equipment can add to safe riding.

results.title: Bike ed in action; be seen to be safe.
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Mark Laughlin, David Ferris, Ivan Gaal, Bike Ed and Materials production, Education Dept
results.brief_description: This compilation tape consists of two programs covering various aspects of bicycle safety. “Bike ed in action” highlights the alarming accident rate among Victorian cyclists and reviews the Bike Education Curriculum Unit which aims to develop positive cycling safety skills. Basic cycling safety measures are demonstrated. “Be seen to be safe” looks at some of the precautions young cyclists must take to ensure that they are seen at night.

results.title: Bighorn: Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep, Banff and Jasper National Parks
results.creator_credit: Bill Schmalz, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A far closer view, and a more complete one, than even the hardiest and most patient of visitors is likely to get of the bighorn mountain sheep of the Canadian Rocky Mountains. “Bighorn” is a film distinguished by its camerawork (Bill Schmalz). It catches the characteristic behavior of the bighorns from birth to mating time. Few animals are more arresting in appearance or activity than these dancers of the high ledges. Awards: Novi Sad; Spindleruv Mlyn; Philadelphia; Tarbes.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.brief_description: Focuses on problems facing wildlife and wilderness areas in the United States. Gives the history of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and describes its relationship to its environment. This film was made with the assistance of Yellowstone National Park, Glacier National Park and Grand Teton National Park.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.creator_credit: Robert Riger, Eleanor Riger and Tomorrow Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hosted by John Denver, this program considers the habitat and behavior of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and shows how the lives of the sheep are being threatened by the activities of man. Denver speaks and sings of the oneness with the world he feels during his trip through the mountains and of how people must relearn to respect nature, her laws and inhabitants. The trip covers the period from early spring through winter, and many animals are glimpsed and discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Biggie and Tupac
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Michele D'Acosta and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Flawed but intriguing documentary from Nick Broomfield, about the deaths of rival African American rappers, Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls. Tupac Shakur was born into an impoverished and fractured family life, but went on to become a hugely successful musician; Biggie Smalls came from less humble beginnings but was similarly successful in his field. Once close friends, these two became bitter rivals in a gang war between rappers and their entourages on the East and West coasts. By interviewing a slew of the pair’s contemporaries, including Biggie’s mother, Broomfield investigates the possibility that Death Records impresario Suge Knight murdered the two and that the LA police were complicit. Broomfield certainly stumbles where angels fear to tread, including a visit to prison to interview Knight, as well as filming some very agitated characters, presenting an ambivalent but fascinating portrait for the viewer to draw on.

results.title: Bigger, faster, stronger
results.creator_credit: Scott Whitaker, W O. Whitaker and Brigham Young University
results.brief_description: Narrated by world discus thrower, L. Jay Sylvester, tells how weight training is used to produce bigger, faster, stronger athletes. Features championship high school, college and professional athletes, and shows that sucess in athletics come only to who make a real commitment.

results.title: Bigger than Texas
results.creator_credit: Mark Pugh, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: During a bank hold-up the robber and one of his victims strike up an unlikely rapport. An ‘almost’ love story about the chance meeting of two misfits in search of escape routes from their sordid lives. The music and Pugh’s photography propel these intriguing characters through a world of surreal suspense.

results.title: Bigfoot in Harry and the Hendersons
results.creator_credit: William Dear, Richard Vane and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: George Henderson (John Lithgow) is on the way home from a camping trip with his wife Nancy and children Sarah and Ernie, when he accidentally hits and kills what seems to be a wild animal. A closer inspection reveals what they all believe to be the mythical ‘Big Foot’. Visions of richness are revealed to George, and against his family’s wishes, takes the dead creature home with him. Later that night, strange noises wake the entire family, who go downstairs to find Harry, the Big Foot they killed, is actually alive. Their lives are turned upside down by Harry, who destroys their house, but gains their love. The Hendersons decide the best thing for Harry would be to return him to the wild, but before they can, he escapes. Hot on his trail are amateur hunters and professional ‘Big Foot’ hunter, Jaques Lefleur (David Suchet). The family, with the help of environmentalist, Dr Wallace Wrightwood (Don Ameche) race against time to return Harry to his home - before he ends up in a zoo.

results.title: Big, grey and tubey
results.creator_credit: Sage Armstrong, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When the tornado hit, Sage Armstrong and her mother took shelter in the toilet. Traumatised by the experience, Armstrong was able to find solace in helping others in the aftermath.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
